Tu seras responsable de l’assemblage des cartes électroniques ainsi que de leurs mises en marche; Tu aideras au déverminage des premières versions des circuits; Tu participeras aux tests des circuits et aux prises de mesures avec oscilloscope et analyseur logique; Tu seras à l’avant-plan des dernières innovations technologiques en étant impliqué dans l’assemblage de nos prototypes (« mockups »); Tu maintiendras l’inventaire de composants électroniques pour assurer l’approvisionnement en cartes, et faire le suivi des commandes de pièces chez nos fournisseurs; Tu effectueras divers tests de contrôle de qualité des kits de développement; Tu t’amuseras et tu apprendras à tous jours! Tu possèdes un DEC en systèmes ordinés ou en électronique ou équivalent; Tu as de l’expérience en débogage et support technique (ça peut être à l’école, dans tes loisirs ou avec ton expérience de travail); Tu as des habiletés marquées pour diagnostiquer et solutionner des problématiques électroniques; Tu es débrouillard(e), flexible et tu veux apprendre; Tu n’as pas peur de poser des questions et d’aller chercher l’information au besoin. Tu es reconnu(e) pour ta capacité à travailler en équipe; Tu as une bonne dextérité manuelle et tu es minutieux(se). Tu as de l’expérience en soudure Tu sais te débrouiller en anglais (lecture/écriture) Pour faire partie de la révolution haptique, être un pionnier(ère) dans notre marché. Ce n’est pas pour rien que le EE Times a nommé Boréas parmi les start-up de semi-conducteurs à suivre à l’international dans le classement 2021 du EE Times Silicon 100! Beaucoup de liberté et d’autonomie au travail ce qui laisse place à la créativité et à l’innovation. Une équipe dynamique, motivée et très compétente. Une organisation qui considère que le développement professionnel et humain est essentiel à notre succès. Une offre salariale globale compétitive, incluant :
Un forfait d’avantages sociaux complet, payé à 75% par Boréas
assurance dentaire, visuelle, médicale, invalidité
L’accès à des soins de santé virtuels et un programme d’aide aux employés
Un REER collectif
Un bonus annuel Un forfait d’avantages sociaux complet, payé à 75% par Boréas assurance dentaire, visuelle, médicale, invalidité L’accès à des soins de santé virtuels et un programme d’aide aux employés Un REER collectif Un bonus annuel Des heures de travail flexibles et jusqu’à 5 journées de congé pour affaires personnelles pour faciliter la conciliation travail, vie, passion, famille! Un environnement de travail agréable et sain. Nos bureaux sont situés en pleine nature, dans le parc scientifique de Bromont alias la Silicon Valley du Québec, ce qui permet de travailler dans un superbe environnement calme et magnifique. Une cafétéria et terrasse aménagées pour les pauses et les heures de lunch. Fait divers : l’équipe tient mordicus à prendre son café ensemble quotidiennement à 10h30. Comme quoi le bonheur au travail tient parfois à peu de choses! Du Go Kart aux 5@7 improvisés dans les microbrasseries de la région, nous faisons régulièrement des activités sociales et de « team building ».

ScrapedJobID10:
The functions listed describe the business purpose of this job. Specific duties or tasks may vary and be documented separately. The employee might not be required to perform all functions listed. Additional duties may be assigned, and functions may be modified, according to business necessity. All assigned duties or tasks are deemed to be part of the essential functions, unless such duties or tasks are unrelated to the functions listed, in which case they are deemed to be other (non-essential) functions. Employees are held accountable for successful job performance. Job performance standards may be documented separately, and may include functions, objectives, duties or tasks not specifically listed herein. In performing functions, duties or tasks, employees are required to know and follow safe work practices, and to be aware of company policies and procedures related to job safety, including safety rules and regulations. Employees are required to notify superiors upon becoming aware of unsafe working conditions. All functions, duties or tasks are to be carried out in an honest, ethical and professional manner, and to be performed in conformance with applicable company policies and procedures. In the event of uncertainty or lack of knowledge of company policies and procedures, employees are required to request clarification or explanations from superiors or authorized company representatives. Must be at least 18 years of age. Must have a reliable means of communication (i.e., pager or phone). Must have a reliable means of transportation (public or private). Must have the legal right to work in the Canada. Must have the ability to speak, read, and write English and French in the province of Quebec. Must have a High School Diploma or GED. If not, must be willing to complete the GED program within six months. Must be willing to participate in the Company’s pre-employment screening process, including background investigation. Must be able to meet and continue to meet any applicable licensing requirements for Security Guards. Driving record must meet company and/or insurance standards. Knowledge of or ability to learn security operations and procedures. Ability to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagrammatic form. Ability to be an effective team member and to work independently. Ability to maintain professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances. Courteous telephone manner. Ability to adapt to changes in the external environment and organization. Ability to write routine correspondence, including logs and reports. Good organizational skills. Ability to provide high quality customer service. Good interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures. Maintaining composure in dealing with authorities, executives, clients, staff and the public, occasionally under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations. May be exposed to stressful situations, such as challenging individuals who are in or approaching an unauthorized area. Must undergo and meet company standards for background and reference checks and behavioral selection survey, in addition to any mandatory licensing requirements. May be required to work overtime without advance notice. Required ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently. Keyboarding, basic computer usage and operating controls. Seeing, hearing, speaking, and writing clearly in order to communicate with employees and clients, observe and report incidents, and direct others. Frequent sitting, standing and walking, that may involve climbing stairs and walking up inclines and on uneven terrain. Occasional reaching with hands and arms, stooping, kneeling, crouching and crawling. Frequent lifting and/or moving up to 10 pounds and occasional lifting and/or moving up to 25 pounds. Close vision, distance vision, and ability to adjust focus. May require driving vehicle for long periods of time in the performance of duties. On occasion may be required to perform stressful and physical activity. Depending upon assignment may be exposed to inclement weather or be required to work in environments or under conditions that require the use of protective gear and devices and/or awareness of personal safety and safety of others. May be exposed to or required to handle sensitive and confidential information.

ScrapedJobID20:
Driller Assistants help the Driller obtain core samples, which our clients use to design foundations for new buildings, refineries, roads, dams, etc. On a typical day, Driller Assistants load drills and trucks with all the tooling and supplies required for the job. The Driller Assistant may then drive the drill or a support truck to the job. Working closely with the Driller and the client, the Driller Assistant prepares sampling devices, gives samples to the client, gets augers and other drill tooling for the driller (this involves heavy lifting), and keeps the work area clean by shoveling dirt away from the borehole. The work is outdoors, and very physically demanding. We’re VERY serious about safety, so don’t consider applying if you are the type of person who cuts corners or can’t follow safe work practices. No experience necessary. The work is outdoors year-round, in all weather. Drug and alcohol testing is a mandatory requirement of our clients. If you can’t pass, you can’t work. Candidates MUST have flexible schedules and be willing work out of town frequently. Job sites and hours of work change often. A good driving record is required (no more than 2 tickets, none serious, and NO DUI’s.) Being on time is a must, as is the ability to work safely as part of a team. Candidates MUST have their own transportation to get to and from our Edmonton or Calgary shops. Oilfield experience is NOT an asset. We wish to thank all those who apply. Due to the volume of applicants, however, we will only contact those selected for an interview.

The functions listed describe the business purpose of this job. Specific duties or tasks may vary and be documented separately. The employee might not be required to perform all functions listed. Additional duties may be assigned, and functions may be modified, according to business necessity. All assigned duties or tasks are deemed to be part of the essential functions, unless such duties or tasks are unrelated to the functions listed, in which case they are deemed to be other (non-essential) functions. Employees are held accountable for successful job performance. Job performance standards may be documented separately, and may include functions, objectives, duties or tasks not specifically listed herein. In performing functions, duties or tasks, employees are required to know and follow safe work practices, and to be aware of company policies and procedures related to job safety, including safety rules and regulations. Employees are required to notify superiors upon becoming aware of unsafe working conditions. All functions, duties or tasks are to be carried out in an honest, ethical and professional manner, and to be performed in conformance with applicable company policies and procedures. In the event of uncertainty or lack of knowledge of company policies and procedures, employees are required to request clarification or explanations from superiors or authorized company representatives. Must be at least 18 years of age. Must have a reliable means of communication (i.e., pager or phone). Must have a reliable means of transportation (public or private). Must have the legal right to work in the Canada. Must have the ability to speak, read, and write English and French in the province of Quebec. Must have a High School Diploma or GED. If not, must be willing to complete the GED program within six months. Must be willing to participate in the Company’s pre-employment screening process, including background investigation. Must be able to meet and continue to meet any applicable licensing requirements for Security Guards. Driving record must meet company and/or insurance standards. Knowledge of or ability to learn security operations and procedures. Ability to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagrammatic form. Ability to be an effective team member and to work independently. Ability to maintain professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances. Courteous telephone manner. Ability to adapt to changes in the external environment and organization. Ability to write routine correspondence, including logs and reports. Good organizational skills. Ability to provide high quality customer service. Good interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures. Maintaining composure in dealing with authorities, executives, clients, staff and the public, occasionally under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations. May be exposed to stressful situations, such as challenging individuals who are in or approaching an unauthorized area. Must undergo and meet company standards for background and reference checks and behavioral selection survey, in addition to any mandatory licensing requirements. May be required to work overtime without advance notice. Required ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently. Keyboarding, basic computer usage and operating controls. Seeing, hearing, speaking, and writing clearly in order to communicate with employees and clients, observe and report incidents, and direct others. Frequent sitting, standing and walking, that may involve climbing stairs and walking up inclines and on uneven terrain. Occasional reaching with hands and arms, stooping, kneeling, crouching and crawling. Frequent lifting and/or moving up to 10 pounds and occasional lifting and/or moving up to 25 pounds. Close vision, distance vision, and ability to adjust focus. May require driving vehicle for long periods of time in the performance of duties. On occasion may be required to perform stressful and physical activity. Depending upon assignment may be exposed to inclement weather or be required to work in environments or under conditions that require the use of protective gear and devices and/or awareness of personal safety and safety of others. May be exposed to or required to handle sensitive and confidential information.

ScrapedJobID26:
Driller Assistants help the Driller obtain core samples, which our clients use to design foundations for new buildings, refineries, roads, dams, etc. On a typical day, Driller Assistants load drills and trucks with all the tooling and supplies required for the job. The Driller Assistant may then drive the drill or a support truck to the job. Working closely with the Driller and the client, the Driller Assistant prepares sampling devices, gives samples to the client, gets augers and other drill tooling for the driller (this involves heavy lifting), and keeps the work area clean by shoveling dirt away from the borehole. The work is outdoors, and very physically demanding. We’re VERY serious about safety, so don’t consider applying if you are the type of person who cuts corners or can’t follow safe work practices. No experience necessary. The work is outdoors year-round, in all weather. Drug and alcohol testing is a mandatory requirement of our clients. If you can’t pass, you can’t work. Candidates MUST have flexible schedules and be willing work out of town frequently. Job sites and hours of work change often. A good driving record is required (no more than 2 tickets, none serious, and NO DUI’s.) Being on time is a must, as is the ability to work safely as part of a team. Candidates MUST have their own transportation to get to and from our Edmonton or Calgary shops. Oilfield experience is NOT an asset. We wish to thank all those who apply. Due to the volume of applicants, however, we will only contact those selected for an interview.

ScrapedJobID83:
effectue le transport, la manutention, l’entreposage de différents biens, équipements et matériaux du Parc olympique; pour ce faire, est appelée à opérer de la machinerie de plusieurs types et formats, ainsi que des accessoires et remorques. La machinerie peut être sans s’y limiter : chariot élévateur, plateforme élévatrice, nacelle aérienne articulée, chariot télescopique rotatif, nacelle araignée, chargeuse sur roues, tracteurs, souffleur à neige, camion de déneigement, etc.; effectue le chargement et le déchargement du matériel transporté; assure les manœuvres adéquates de machinerie lors de manipulations complexes et sensibles; effectue divers travaux d’entretien général à l’aide d’un véhicule, de machinerie spécialisée ou d’un équipement mobile; fait l’installation, l’ajustement et le démantèlement d’équipements divers ou de matériaux requérant de la machinerie et de l’assistance manuelle; procède au remplacement des drapeaux sur les aires extérieures et l’aire de jeu avec les équipements appropriés (chariot télescopique ou nacelle articulée); au besoin, assiste les promoteurs et les autres services avec les équipements et la machinerie requis. Déplace et opère la machinerie spécialisée dans des environnements à complexité variable; effectue divers montages et livraisons lors des événements. Scènes, chapiteaux, mobilier, barrières de contrôle de foule, pesées routières, blocs et cloches de béton, etc.; procède au déplacement des gradins mobiles et rétractables. À cet effet, elle manipule les couvercles de rails, vérins, passerelles panneaux de périphérie et opère les tableaux de commande; effectue le déneigement de toutes les aires ou surfaces nécessaires aux opérations quotidiennes et d’urgence du Parc olympique. À ce titre, elle opère l’outillage nécessaire: camions de déneigement, épandeuses à abrasifs, souffleuse à neige manuelle, petit tracteur, chargeuse sur roues, tracteur 100 forces avec souffleur etc., voit aux mélanges appropriés d’abrasifs et aux proportions d’épandage selon les différents types de sol; effectue divers travaux de terrassement ou d’entretien tel la coupe de gazon et l’émondage à l’aide de l’équipement approprié. Effectue l’arrosage des nouveaux arbres et de la nouvelle pelouse, procède à la réparation des sols, à l’ensemencement et à la pose de tourbe; s’assure de la propreté, de l’ordre et du bon état physique de son lieu de travail et de ses équipements; selon les demandes de services, elle peut être appelée à pourvoir clientèles du Parc olympique en matière de mobilier et de matériaux requis pour des activités; au besoin, communique avec le client pour un supplément d’information ou pour arrimer son travail avec les disponibilités de ce dernier. Interagit avec la clientèle et prend les décisions appropriées à son champ d’expertise en conformité avec les standards de service à la clientèle appropriés; lit et interprète les plans ou schémas d’aménagement, au besoin; utilise des outils manuels et portatifs motorisés ou non, opère les équipements requis pour l’exécution de ses travaux, et conduit tout véhicule approprié dans le cadre de ses fonctions en effectuant les vérifications nécessaires avant l’utilisation (ex : tracteur, tondeuse, débroussailleuse, souffleuse, chariot élévateur, plateforme élévatrice, nacelle rotative ou articulée, nacelle araignée, chargeuse, camionnette avec ou sans pelle, ; s’assure du bon état des appareils utilisés quotidiennement, rapporte toute défectuosité à son supérieur; fait ajouter de l’huile, au besoin, et fait le plein d’essence; lave l’appareil et veille à le maintenir propre. Elle effectue ou fait effectuer aux fréquences prévues les vérifications nécessaires; s’assure de respecter toute les normes de sécurités existantes lors de l’utilisation des divers équipements; prend les mesures nécessaires pour protéger sa santé, sa sécurité et son intégrité physique et celle de ses collègues ou de toute autre personne qui se trouve sur les lieux de travail ou à proximité. Dans ce contexte, elle peut être appelée à opérer de la machinerie de levage à partir du sol ou dans une nacelle, avec à bord une ou des personnes en hauteur; peut être appelée à exécuter différents travaux de creusage ou de remplissage, d’étendage, d’aplanissement, de nivelage, de foulage de terre, de gravier et autres du même genre; participe activement à l’entretien préventif des équipements, selon le calendrier établi ou au besoin; peut-être appelée à participer à l’entretien de certaines machineries avec les mécaniciens d’appareils motorisés; participe à divers projets avec d’autres quarts de métiers, techniciens, professionnels, clients ou partenaires en vue d’atteindre les objectifs de réalisation, communique et interagit quotidiennement avec les clientèles externes et internes; au besoin, fait des bons de travail et inscrit les informations pertinentes à la fermeture de ces derniers en respectant les procédures établies; utilise des outils technologiques de l’information et des communications mis à sa disposition en lien avec les travaux à réaliser; dans l’accomplissement de ses fonctions, peut être appelée à initier au travail les nouveaux employés; est appelée à travailler en hauteur avec les différents équipements selon les normes en vigueur; au besoin, elle accomplit toute autre tâche connexe. détenir un diplôme d’études secondaires (DES); détenir plus de trois (3) mois reliés aux attributions de l’emploi; détenir un permis de conduire classe 5.

Identifie des formations requises pour son personnel et donne du coaching aux employés de son secteur, principalement aux nouveaux employés permanents ou temporaires, afin de faciliter leur intégration et d’améliorer la performance de l’équipe. Encourage le partage des expériences et connaissances entre les employés et avec ses collègues. S’assure de la bonne qualité des relations de son personnel assigné avec le public et les employés des autres services. Applique les clauses de la convention collective en vigueur. Reçoit, analyse et donne suite aux griefs ou selon le cas, les soumet à son supérieur. Implante rapidement les actions pour éviter les récidives. Prépare et suit un échéancier des travaux à effectuer pendant l’année et participe à la préparation du budget de son secteur. Prépare tous les rapports administratifs demandés par son supérieur, en particulier ceux qui concernent le suivi et le contrôle relatifs à la nature du travail de son secteur et au temps travaillé par ses employés. Contrôle les feuilles de temps des employés qui lui sont assignés, s’assure d’obtenir les justifications nécessaires dans les cas d’absences et entreprend les mesures appropriées pour assurer une productivité optimale. Soumet un rapport à son supérieur sur les activités de son groupe assigné et suggère des procédures et des méthodes visant l’amélioration de l’efficacité des activités. Au besoin, compile et analyse les statistiques relatives aux coûts d’opération de son secteur et formule les recommandations appropriées à son supérieur. Complète les réquisitions d’achat pour le secteur qui lui est assigné, détermine l’approbation budgétaire et soumet les formulaires conformément à la politique d’achat en vigueur. Participe, en collaboration avec son supérieur, à la réalisation du PTI, en collaborant à l’accomplissement de certains travaux ainsi qu’à l’acquisition des véhicules et des équipements prévus. Respecte le plan directeur à cet effet et fait des liens avec le service d’approvisionnement, et ce, en respectant les délais fixés dans la rédaction des devis. Tient à jour la liste officielle des équipements de la Ville et le dossier de chaque pièce d’équipement. S’assure que les employés tiennent un journal de bord pour chacun des véhicules de la Ville et effectue les suivis requis. Utilise des outils technologiques de géolocalisation pour suivre les déplacements des véhicules de la Ville. ScrapedJobID209:
Driller Assistants help the Driller obtain core samples, which our clients use to design foundations for new buildings, refineries, roads, dams, etc. On a typical day, Driller Assistants load drills and trucks with all the tooling and supplies required for the job. The Driller Assistant may then drive the drill or a support truck to the job. Working closely with the Driller and the client, the Driller Assistant prepares sampling devices, gives samples to the client, gets augers and other drill tooling for the driller (this involves heavy lifting), and keeps the work area clean by shoveling dirt away from the borehole. The work is outdoors, and very physically demanding. We’re VERY serious about safety, so don’t consider applying if you are the type of person who cuts corners or can’t follow safe work practices. No experience necessary. The work is outdoors year-round, in all weather. Drug and alcohol testing is a mandatory requirement of our clients. If you can’t pass, you can’t work. Candidates MUST have flexible schedules and be willing work out of town frequently. Job sites and hours of work change often. A good driving record is required (no more than 2 tickets, none serious, and NO DUI’s.) Being on time is a must, as is the ability to work safely as part of a team. Candidates MUST have their own transportation to get to and from our Edmonton or Calgary shops. Oilfield experience is NOT an asset. We wish to thank all those who apply. Due to the volume of applicants, however, we will only contact those selected for an interview.

ScrapedJobID211:
est la première répondante de la clientèle interne et externe en s’assurant la centralisation des appels de service, effectue le suivi des demandes et coordonne ces dernières; premier répondant sur les lieux lors des alarmes ou bris, il diagnostique les systèmes et transmet les directives de réparation; participe à la gestion de la consommation énergétique du site ou des divers systèmes électromécaniques. Par conséquent, elle doit analyser la situation et prendre une décision en considérant les impacts envisagés sur la clientèle du Parc olympique; surveille, opère et valide le fonctionnement de divers systèmes mécaniques du bâtiment via le système de centralisation, intervient lors des défaillances, émet des commandes de travail, renseigne les divers corps de métiers lors des interventions et collabore avec les diverses équipes techniques lors de coupures de services; effectue divers contrôles et interventions, prépare les relevés périodiques et rapports en conséquence, en autre, elle assure le respect des normes de qualité de l’air en vigueur, programme les systèmes de centralisation sous sa juridiction, participe à la réalisation des cahiers d’opération, élabore les schémas, les plans et les procédures des systèmes et voit à leurs améliorations; effectue des réparations, investigue et recherche la cause des pannes ou bris, effectue des recherches et commande le matériel selon les besoins; participe aux mises en services, aux projets, à l’optimisation des systèmes et au commissionning continu des systèmes mécaniques du bâtiment; vérifie, répare, calibre, ajuste, remplace et teste tout genre d’appareils et dispositifs de contrôle électroniques, mécaniques, hydroniques ou pneumatiques tels que : transmetteurs, indicateurs, enregistreurs, servomoteurs, contrôles à distance et tout autre appareillage de mesure de pression, de température, de débit, de volume et de vitesse, etc.; participe au développement et à l’amélioration de l’équipement d’instrumentation, de contrôle de régulation relié aux systèmes électromécaniques. Elle doit par le fait même procéder à la programmation, à la mise en service et documenter les projets ou modifications effectués; participe au développement du système d’accès et de sécurité du site et en fait la programmation; afin de les orienter, de vérifier la qualité des travaux, d’assister aux mises en service des projets livrés et déterminer les défaillances, peut être appelée à coordonner des sous-traitants; détenir un diplôme d’études collégiales (DEC) en électronique avec spécialisation en instrumentation et contrôle mécanique tout autre combinaison de formation pertinente; détenir un certificat en connexion d’appareillage (RCA) émis par Emploi Québec; détenir plus de 2 ans d’expérience pertinente reliée aux attributions de l’emploi. avoir une connaissance approfondie des systèmes mécaniques HAVC; bonne connaissance des normes de l’ASHREA (American Society of Heating, Refrigerating and Air Conditioning Engineers); connaissance des outils MS Office (Word, Excel); connaissance de logiciels de dessins, Visio, GIMP (un atout); bonne connaissance de la langue anglaise.

Ces surfaces peuvent être de différentes compositions telles que le métal, le bois, le plâtre, le plastique et les polymères. Pose les rubans, prépare les bouche-pores et les applique sur les surfaces, effectue le sablage, prépare les matériaux de calfeutrage et exécute le calfeutrage; Enlève les enduits à l'aide de différents instruments appropriés (grattoir, fer chauffant, chalumeau, ponceuse, rectifieuse, etc.) et de différentes substances appropriées (décapant, diluant, Varsol, etc.); Ponce, peint, teint et vernit le mobilier, les accessoires des véhicules motorisés ou d'autres objets et surfaces à l'aide des équipements requis, tels que rouleau, pinceau, fusil, ponceuse électrique, papier abrasif et autres. À cet égard, utilise les différents types de peinture utilisés dans le secteur (p. ex. : époxy, etc.); Effectue divers travaux de peinture à l'aide d'un stencil, d'un pochoir ou de tout autre équipement utilisé dans le secteur ou mis à sa disposition; Dresse des échafaudages ou en surveille le dressage. Installe ou fait installer des échelles, des palans et délimite l'aire de travail. Est appelée à travailler en hauteur avec les équipements appropriés; Déplace du mobilier, des appareils, des objets pour l'exécution des travaux et les remet en place lorsque les travaux sont terminés; Prépare les surfaces, enlève ou applique les tapisseries ou autres matériaux de scellement d'une couleur s'harmonisant avec celle du cadre; Au besoin, effectue divers travaux d'entretien et de réparation de carrelage de céramique, de tuiles de vinyle ou tout autre type de carrelage; Communique avec les personnes requérantes afin de recevoir les renseignements nécessaires à l'exécution des travaux, donner des conseils appropriés en relation avec les travaux à effectuer et d'informer des dates et des heures où les travaux seront exécutés; Remplit des rapports d'activités (Demandes E ou autres) en y inscrivant le temps de main-d'oeuvre et la liste du matériel utilisé ou requis, puis la remet à son chef d'équipe; Donne des renseignements aux personnels techniques et de recherches ainsi qu'à la clientèle étudiante sur les types de matériel à utiliser et leur fournit sur demande; Rencontre les personnes représentantes de différents fournisseurs; Utilise un système informatisé de traitement de l'information. Rédige des rapports d'activités et tient à jour des registres; En conformité avec les réquisitions, prépare et utilise le matériel et l'équipement tel que requis; Manipule, transporte, règle, ajuste et utilise son atelier mobile, la machinerie, les outils et les matériaux appropriés. Voit à leur entretien, à la propreté et à la sécurité du lieu de travail; Tient à jour l'inventaire du matériel et de l'outillage de son atelier mobile et voit à son approvisionnement. Voit au bon état de son atelier; Prend les mesures appropriées et signale, selon le cas, à son supérieur immédiat toute anomalie, défectuosité, situation ou problème; Accomplit temporairement les tâches d'un poste connexe ou inférieur lorsque requis. Diplôme d'études secondaires (DES) et diplôme d'études professionnelles (DEP) en peinture en bâtiment. Certificat de compétence - compagnon (CCC) (valide et reconnue) de la Commission de la construction du Québec (CCQ) dans le métier de peintre. Deux (2) à trois (3) années d'expérience pertinente. Connaissance de base de l'informatique.

Hold each member of the store team accountable to meeting / exceeding company expectations through weekly productivity conversations, daily coaching in the moment, performance recognition, and performance action notices as necessary. Spends 85% of their working time on the sales floor engaging with consumers, selling, and coaching employees. Accountable for payroll control and selling driven scheduling in order to maintain a highly profitable location while providing the highest levels of service to customers. This role involves frequent stationary standing, reaching, bending/twisting of head, maintaining balance while walking, occasional kneeling, crouching, climbing, bending/stooping at waist/torso and sitting to assist customers, pushing/pulling equipment such as shelving bays, dollies, carts, and racks with up to 20 pounds of force as well as lifting/carrying/placing boxes of product up to 30 pounds in weight at heights up to 131 inches while using a ladder. The role requires using ladder/step stool equipment, and maintaining the organization and cleanliness of the sales and stock area are also required. Environmental factors of action include operation of foot controls for operating mobile stock shelving bays and exposure to working at heights. Use of the following senses are critical to this position: speaking, hearing, near & far acuity, depth perception and field of vision. Cognitive factors critical to this function are: reading comprehension, basic math calculations, writing, complex problem solving and basic computer work.

Effectuer une orientation de l'hôtel et accompagner les clients jusqu'à la chambre/suite ; Veiller à ce que le client ait une parfaite continuité de qualité de service entre la journée et la nuit ; S’assurer personnellement que toutes les demandes reçues du client tout au long de son séjour sont traitées du début à la fin, y compris les problèmes potentiels (c. sur pour assurer terminé, etc.); Pendant le séjour, contacter le client au moins une fois par jour (mais en fonction des besoins du client) et s'assurer d’être présent chaque fois que possible au début de toute activité pré-réservée ; Assurer un service synchronisé entre les départements (Réception, Entretien ménager, Room Service, Blanchisserie etc.); Vérifier si le client a réservé le transport de départ ou proposer de réserver si nécessaire et organiser la collecte des bagages et être disponible lors du départ du client pour lui dire aurevoir ; Suivre toutes les demandes/notes tout au long de leur séjour et mettre à jour les préférences dans Golden ; Vérifier la facture des clients VIP avant le départ pour s'assurer qu'elle est correcte et proposer une assistance au départ ; Dire aurevoir au client au départ, surtout au rez-de-chaussée ; Envoyer un message Chat de suivi après le départ ; Exécuter et évaluer les rapports d'arrivée afin de s'assurer que les directives de reconnaissance des clients sont appliquées correctement et partagées dans les forums pertinents (briefing du matin, réunion OPS) ; Être le contact très personnel des clients Elite et signaler toutes les activités spéciales à l'ensemble de l'Hôtel ; Exécuter le rapport d'arrivée Elite 3 jours à l'avance et le communiquer avec GM, HM et FOM ; Fournir une assistance de dépannage de base pour les services en chambre tels qu'Internet, TV, iPad… ; Travailler en étroite collaboration avec la réception et les services à la clientèle pour assurer le bon traitement de l'arrivée, des bagages des clients, des livraisons, des demandes spéciales et du départ; Avoir une bonne résistance au stress et le gérer de manière positive et efficace ; Être à l’aise dans un environnement à cadence rapide ; Faire preuve d’un très bon esprit d’équipe ; Intérêt et aptitude à offrir un service hors pair à nos clients internes, externes et nos fournisseurs ; Avoir une excellente présentation, une bonne élocution, en français et en anglais, et de bonnes compétences relationnelles pour correspondre aux attentes d’une clientèle haut de gamme; Maintenir un aspect professionnel et se conduire de façon mature et avec intégrité en tout temps Attention au détail et capacité à effectuer plusieurs tâches dans un environnement dynamique ; Être organisé, méticuleux et débrouillard ; Faire preuve de créativité et d’esprit d’initiative ; Disponible les soirs, jours fériés et fin de semaine ; Bonnes compétences informatiques, y compris une connaissance pratique de MS Outlook, Word, Excel, Power Point, Adobe, Delphi et Opera; Participate in the morning meeting by using Golden every day; Update Elite guests’ status (health check, special arrangements, glitches and other VIP guests) during morning meeting and daily briefing; During the stay the Guest Relations agent will touch base with the guest at least once per day (but based on the guest requirements) and ensure they are present whenever possible at the start of any pre-booked activity; Ensure synchronized service between departments (Front Office, Concierge, Housekeeping, Room Service, Laundry etc.); Check if guest has departure transport booked or offer to book if necessary and arrange luggage collection and to be available upon guest departure to wish farewell; Maintain a professional appearance and behave in a mature manner with integrity at all times; Attention to detail and ability to multitask in a dynamic environment; Be organized, meticulous and resourceful; The functions listed describe the business purpose of this job. Specific duties or tasks may vary and be documented separately. The employee might not be required to perform all functions listed. Additional duties may be assigned, and functions may be modified, according to business necessity. All assigned duties or tasks are deemed to be part of the essential functions, unless such duties or tasks are unrelated to the functions listed, in which case they are deemed to be other (non-essential) functions. Employees are held accountable for successful job performance. Job performance standards may be documented separately, and may include functions, objectives, duties or tasks not specifically listed herein. In performing functions, duties or tasks, employees are required to know and follow safe work practices, and to be aware of company policies and procedures related to job safety, including safety rules and regulations. Employees are required to notify superiors upon becoming aware of unsafe working conditions. All functions, duties or tasks are to be carried out in an honest, ethical and professional manner, and to be performed in conformance with applicable company policies and procedures. In the event of uncertainty or lack of knowledge of company policies and procedures, employees are required to request clarification or explanations from superiors or authorized company representatives. Must be at least 18 years of age. Must have a reliable means of communication (i.e., pager or phone). Must have a reliable means of transportation (public or private). Must have the legal right to work in the Canada. Must have the ability to speak, read, and write English and French in the province of Quebec. Must have a High School Diploma or GED. If not, must be willing to complete the GED program within six months. Must be willing to participate in the Company’s pre-employment screening process, including background investigation. Must be able to meet and continue to meet any applicable licensing requirements for Security Guards. Driving record must meet company and/or insurance standards. Knowledge of or ability to learn security operations and procedures. Ability to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagrammatic form. Ability to be an effective team member and to work independently. Ability to maintain professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances. Courteous telephone manner. Ability to adapt to changes in the external environment and organization. Ability to write routine correspondence, including logs and reports. Good organizational skills. Ability to provide high quality customer service. Good interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures. Maintaining composure in dealing with authorities, executives, clients, staff and the public, occasionally under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations. May be exposed to stressful situations, such as challenging individuals who are in or approaching an unauthorized area. Must undergo and meet company standards for background and reference checks and behavioral selection survey, in addition to any mandatory licensing requirements. May be required to work overtime without advance notice. Required ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently. Keyboarding, basic computer usage and operating controls. Seeing, hearing, speaking, and writing clearly in order to communicate with employees and clients, observe and report incidents, and direct others. Frequent sitting, standing and walking, that may involve climbing stairs and walking up inclines and on uneven terrain. Occasional reaching with hands and arms, stooping, kneeling, crouching and crawling. Frequent lifting and/or moving up to 10 pounds and occasional lifting and/or moving up to 25 pounds. Close vision, distance vision, and ability to adjust focus. May require driving vehicle for long periods of time in the performance of duties. On occasion may be required to perform stressful and physical activity. Depending upon assignment may be exposed to inclement weather or be required to work in environments or under conditions that require the use of protective gear and devices and/or awareness of personal safety and safety of others. May be exposed to or required to handle sensitive and confidential information.

A Police Information Check satisfactory to the employer will be required from the successful applicant, at their expense. Must possess and maintain a valid Inter-provincial Journeyman Welding Certificate with Red Seal. Must possess and maintain a valid Class 5 Manitoba Driver’s Licence. Must be physically capable of performing all of the duties and responsibilities of the position including, but not limited to, erecting and working on ladders and scaffolds, and working at heights or in confined spaces, both indoors and outside in varying weather conditions (in the shop and mobile service truck). Must successfully pass a respirator mask fit test (requires employee to be clean shaven at work) and complete confined space training. Writing engaging, accurate and informative articles, at pace, for our commercial partners and Fever Original events. As well as writing articles, you might be creating social media posts, writing video captions, liaising with our marketing team to ensure we’re optimising copy to drive sales and/or awareness, or covering a branded event using Instagram stories. Keeping track of these tasks, across multiple campaigns, will be essential in this role. You’ll also help to generate creative ideas for new campaigns, and manage final feedback from our clients to ensure everything is on point. From time to time, you may have the opportunity to pitch in with editorial work, but you will always be required to prioritise commercial work. That said, this position sits firmly within the editorial team, and you will be expected to have a solid understanding of the Secret Media Network’s native storytelling tactics. 2-5 years of relevant experience. commencement. Lead Job Hazard Analysis when required to ensure risks are identified and controlled Carry out daily safety tool box talks, periodic safety meetings, routine and statutory safety inspections,
root cause analysis and planned task observations as required. Participate in the development, implementation and adherence to safe work procedures/instructions and
promote safety, health and environmental awareness and compliance. Perform QA/QC assessments to
identify gaps and implement control measures for correction of all deviations to procedures and standards
and ensure/verify sustainability of corrections. Monitor and ensure all employee’s competency for assigned tasks, ensuring they are following the
appropriate procedures/instructions/manuals, and are performed without incident, in an environmentally
responsible manner. Investigate task non‐conformances/compliances thoroughly and administer corrective actions up to and
including disciplinary action when required, in conjunction with management. Report, track and approve employee and contractor hours and maintain records hours worked under the
Supervisor’s direction. Use SAP software system effectively to properly document work performed, order parts, check inventory
and monitor equipment history. Monitor all Maintenance equipment and infrastructure condition and ensure preventative maintenance is
performed properly. Advise and act on areas requiring improvement, repair, or correction while ensuring
compliance to all applicable standards. Ensure compliance to planned mobile equipment preventive maintenance schedules. Manage equipment
backlog and track all work performed by employees and contractors under your direction to properly
document task completion. Perform pre PM/intervention inspections of equipment being repaired and perform pre release inspections
on equipment with completed interventions to ensure safe and reliable operating condition. Ensure all
safety and fire prevention systems on all equipment are operating correctly at all times and are operating
as designed. Communicate with the maintenance planners on task progression, parts requirements, task duration, input
schedule information and provide accurate equipment task information. Assist in preparing scopes and
monitoring performance to plan. Ensure plan deviations or deficiencies are communicated to the planners
including specifics pertaining to the causes. Advise and implement corrective measures to achieve desired
plan results. Ensure urgent breakdown repairs are attended to adequately in the shop or field, in a timely manner by
employees or contractors under supervisor direction. Verify required parts and place orders and
communicate breakdowns to the team. Actively promote and cooperate between maintenance, contractors and all other departments in the
operation. Identify opportunities for the continuous improvement of maintenance processes and systems. Action
improvements directly under Supervisor control. Complete reports and perform record keeping as required, ensuring accuracy of reported data. Communicate effectively internally within the department as well as with all other sections and
contractors. Monitor and report on equipment KPIs, perform quality control inspections on assigned tasks, implement
continuous improvement of work being performed and make to reduce deficiencies. Supervisors work shift work to cover continuous operations. Shifts can be Days/Afternoons or Nights. Supervisor must ensure effective communication with all other supervisors, especially during shift and
rotational changes. 10 or more years of mobile maintenance experience with a minimum of 3 or more years performing a Mobile Maintenance Supervisory role in an open pit mining environment. Post‐ Secondary education (College or University) along with a minimum of an interprovincial Red Seal
Certification of Competency in a relevant field for equipment maintenance. Previous experience working in a remote Arctic operation with camp accommodations. SAP maintenance systems expertise and efficiency. Previous experience working with employees of all competency levels including developing individuals with
minimal experience at apprenticeship levels performing maintenance in a mining environment in a remote
camp setting. Experience mentoring, providing solid direction and safety leadership to all employees and contractors
under their direction in harsh arctic field environments and in the workshops. Welding and fabrication experience required with an emphasis on equipment, structural and ground
engaging tool maintenance best practices and procedure development and compliance. Valid Nunavut WSCC Supervisor and First Aid Certificates Extensive experience performing and supervising maintenance being performed on the following

ScrapedJobID568:
Accounting & Bookkeeping - the core of this role will be the day-to-day accounting & bookkeeping. You’ll be performing reconciliation of clients’ books, running payroll, and working with them to make sure their books are up to date. Year-End & Taxes - you’ll help in preparing annual financial statements, corporate tax returns, as well as sales tax returns. You’ll also help in preparing the required information and responses for any audits by CRA or provincial tax agencies. Tax Credits - We help clients claim tax credits, like the SR&ED as well as provincial multimedia tax credits. You’ll be helping in compiling the required information for these claims and preparing the application. Tax Research & Advice - You won’t have all the answers all the time - we get that. Which is why you’ll need to be able to research specific tax situations or any tax or accounting-related questions that our clients may have, and provide clear helpful answers. Communication - while you may have enjoyed all your tax courses, most of our clients didn’t, so they value someone who can talk to them at their level. You should be able to leave any accounting or tax jargon at the door and explain things like a normal human. Confidence and charm go a long way. Attention to Detail – we care about producing a clean, beautiful set of books for our clients. To us, our trial balances and statements are works of art. Tech-Savvy – since all our work is done on the cloud, you should be comfortable with learning and using web and mobile apps. You’re always exploring the latest tech out there and can talk to clients about tech on their level. Self-starter – you require minimal supervision and take responsibility for getting the work done. We’re not big on micro-management, so you decide how and when the work gets done. You also know where to look or who to ask when you don’t know. Accounting & tax knowledge - you’ve completed an accounting diploma or degree and have some knowledge of taxes. Spreadsheets and T2 returns don’t scare you. Excel – you must be an Excel rockstar, able to tame any data thrown at you in your sleep. We’re looking for people who go above and beyond. Use this space to tell us more about yourself. Go beyond your resume and write anything you like about who you are, what sets you apart, or what really excites you about working at Insert Coin. Get personal. Get creative. Show off. Write one line, or two. Or ten. Yes

ScrapedJobID608:
À titre de gestionnaire de projets et chef d’équipe, tu seras responsable de la gestion complète, la planification et du contrôle de projets d'envergures e-commerce pour plusieurs clients nationaux, US ou internationale. Tu seras amené à t’assurer de la santé et de la pérennité des comptes clients en équipe avec nos directeurs de comptes. Mis à part la responsabilité de contrôle et de planification de projets, tu occuperas un rôle de leader envers ton équipe. Tu seras responsable de diriger, de mobiliser et de t’assurer du bien-être des membres de ton équipe ainsi que de leur évolution dans l'entreprise. Contrôler les demandes clients, les budgets, les échéanciers de tous les projets dans ton département Faire le suivi de l’état d’avancement des plans, soulever les écarts, les risques, les enjeux et fournir les plans d’ajustement qui seront mis en œuvre Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les directeurs de comptes pour gérer les demandes, assurer un service de qualité et optimiser la valeur des demandes entrantes Préparer les bilans de santé des comptes clients et les communiquer aux parties prenantes Veiller à ce que les biens livrables correspondent aux objectifs et aux besoins des clients ainsi qu’aux standards établis Suivre les indicateurs de pilotage de manière à atteindre les objectifs de performance de l’organisation. Travailler de pair avec la direction des Opérations & Production ainsi qu'avec tous les partenaires et experts à l'interne. Offrir à ton équipe le support nécessaire à la réalisation des meilleures pratiques À titre de chef d’équipe, exercer un leadership positif et mobiliser les membres de son équipe en s’assurant de leur bonheur et bien-être. Pour découvrir une culture d’entreprise basée sur le respect, le bien-être et l’envie d’avancer (ensemble). The environmental conditions may be hot, cold, dirty, dusty, wet or noisy. Safety is our highest priority, and safety procedures and guidelines must be adhered to at all times, such as lock out / tag out, machine guarding control, confined space entry and Hot Work. This includes wearing personal protective equipment, such as a hard hats, eye protection, hearing protection, respirators, flame retardant clothing and safety shoes with metatarsal protection at all times during a work shift. Employees work in a unionized, highly industrial foundry setting. Our facility operates 24 hours per day, 365 days a year with varying hours of work including 8 and 12 hour rotating shifts of days, afternoons and evenings. This means that you may be required to work different days of the week each time you rotate shifts. In other words, you may be required to work Saturdays, Sundays and holidays. Usual work week is 40 hours but the position requires you to work overtime as needed. Punctuality and attendance are extremely important to the success of the operations in general as well as contributing to an overall positive team environment. This position requires an Industrial Mechanic Millwright Certificate of Qualification (Inter-provincial Red Seal) and a minimum of four years experience in an industrial environment. commencement. Lead Job Hazard Analysis when required to ensure risks are identified and controlled Carry out daily safety tool box talks, periodic safety meetings, routine and statutory safety inspections,

promote safety, health and environmental awareness and compliance. Perform QA/QC assessments to
identify gaps and implement control measures for correction of all deviations to procedures and standards
and ensure/verify sustainability of corrections. Monitor and ensure all employee’s competency for assigned tasks, ensuring they are following the
appropriate procedures/instructions/manuals, and are performed without incident, in an environmentally
responsible manner. Investigate task non‐conformances/compliances thoroughly and administer corrective actions up to and
including disciplinary action when required, in conjunction with management. Report, track and approve employee and contractor hours and maintain records hours worked under the

and monitor equipment history. Monitor all Maintenance equipment and infrastructure condition and ensure preventative maintenance is

monitoring performance to plan. Ensure plan deviations or deficiencies are communicated to the planners

plan results. Ensure urgent breakdown repairs are attended to adequately in the shop or field, in a timely manner by
employees or contractors under supervisor direction. Verify required parts and place orders and
communicate breakdowns to the team. Actively promote and cooperate between maintenance, contractors and all other departments in the
operation. Identify opportunities for the continuous improvement of maintenance processes and systems. Action
improvements directly under Supervisor control. Complete reports and perform record keeping as required, ensuring accuracy of reported data. Communicate effectively internally within the department as well as with all other sections and
contractors. Monitor and report on equipment KPIs, perform quality control inspections on assigned tasks, implement
continuous improvement of work being performed and make to reduce deficiencies. Supervisors work shift work to cover continuous operations. Shifts can be Days/Afternoons or Nights. Supervisor must ensure effective communication with all other supervisors, especially during shift and
rotational changes. 10 or more years of mobile maintenance experience with a minimum of 3 or more years performing a Mobile Maintenance Supervisory role in an open pit mining environment. Post‐ Secondary education (College or University) along with a minimum of an interprovincial Red Seal

Updating support tickets to reflect actions taken, resolution achieved, or further action required. Responding to and solving all support tickets within Service Level Agreement as set out in the contracts. Maintaining a high customer satisfaction score. Creating and maintaining customer support articles to improve documentation and reduce tickets. Creating and managing internal best practices to improve internal knowledge of Platform. Managing internal content and ensuring correct and relevant information. Creating and maintaining best practice, training and other video and training modules for client enablement and training. Escalating issues when required to resolve any technical issues, gaps, errors, etc. Working collaboratively with the Development team on customer support issues. Working with the Marketing team to ensure a consistent voice within support articles. Conducting administrator training, one on one webinars, and monthly support webinar events. And of course, there will be other duties that support the Axonifam and to further build your skills. Professional Experience. 2+ years of experience supporting web-based applications in a customer service or help-desk environment with experience troubleshooting in a SaaS environment. Knowledge. Working knowledge of supported browsers (Chrome, IE, Firefox, Safari) and Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint. An understanding of PC and Mac operating systems, and basic knowledge of various mobile platforms; iOS, Android. Customer Savviness. Excellent customer service skills – the ability to be empathetic, accurate, compassionate, responsive, resourceful, and conscientious. Strong conflict resolution and problem-solving skills that effectively diffuse escalations. Ability to analyze and interpret the needs of customers and offer the appropriate options, solutions, and resolutions required. Energy, passion and creativity. Ability to respond quickly in a dynamic and changing environment. A strong sense of urgency. Performance Mindset. Excellent organizational, written, and oral communication skills - you must be able to convey technical jargon in a wide array of syntax, from beginner to advanced level users, in our tickets, knowledge-based articles and on the phone. Excellent online facilitation skills – the ability to engage the learners and facilitate an interactive webinar. Commitment to quality. Ability to empower platform administrators to support themselves using our knowledge base. Ability to evaluate, troubleshoot, and follow-up on customer issues, as well as replicate and document for further escalation. Other preferred assets: Experience with customer communities. Business Analysis experience an asset. Content development and/or video development knowledge. An impactful product that gives back to the communities and frontline workers that support our everyday lives. People with great attitudes that lead to great results through our values of Collaborate, Be Bold and Get It Done. A diverse Axonifam that celebrates unique perspectives and experiences that add richness to our culture. Leaders that trust deeply who leverage our skills, adapt to us as individuals and encourage us to be our best selves. Flexibility and choice. Early riser? Great, we offer flexible work hours. Prefer to work from home and in the office? No problem, we operate on a hybrid model where you work in the location that supports your personal and professional life. Mac over PC? Take your pick because we want you to have the equipment that you are comfortable with. East or West coast? We have employees that span across Canada, the US and the UK. Eid or Christmas? Our Flexible Holiday Program supports you to take the days off that matter to you. Professional growth. We’re learning experts and our excitement goes beyond our product. Not only do we offer Axonifiers daily learning, continual growth and broad experiences, we also offer a Professional Growth Spending account to encourage more development even outside of work hours.. Wellbeing that supports our lives away from work. We love what we do, but we also love our lives away from Axonify and we encourage employees to enjoy their personal lives with generous vacation time, Axonify holidays, personal days, competitive benefits with a Wellness Spending Account, and in-house workshops such as yoga, financial planning or mental wellbeing and self-care.
